column5: Hi All, I know there are numerous boat rentals available on Rice Lake, but which rental company would you recommend?  Here are the factors I am considering Quality of boat, location on the lake, price  Im looking to rent for 1/2 day.  Thanks for you help.
I have these bookmarked for my visit in the next few weeks: http://www.captainsmarina.com/rates/alumium.php http://www.fishingricelake.com/boats.htm

the man to contact would be "rice laker" here on the forums. he runs whispering pines here is the link http://www.whisperingpinescottages.com/boats.html  he has a great assortment of rentals, even ones with live wells. just make sure you contact him a week before atleast as he gets busy, i found that out the hard way lol.  also you can call 797 boat rentals. the gentlemans name is wilson and he is a class act. i've rented from him many times and he will do his best to please his costumers.  wilson lo 905 797 2828
I"d reccomend Ben from BJ's bait and tackle. They have an awesome tackle shop as well as brand new 4 stroke mercs on 16ft Lund boats. Good guys, I won't go anywhere else. They're in Bewdley.  S.
Lyle and Myrna Brown at Springbank Camp rent good boats at a good price. They are near Roseneath. Jim
another vote for BJs in Bewdely, great people with a well stocked tackle shop

Ridgeview out of Roseneath great boats as well if your going to rent more than once I think your 10th outing is free and rates go down after the first rental.. If your going from Bewdley I suggest Ben from BJ Tackle.
